dataset.title: Project Open Data Dataset
dataset.description: The metadata format for all federal open data. Validates a single JSON object entry (as opposed to entire Data.json catalog).

@type.title: Metadata Context
@type.description: IRI for the JSON-LD data type. This should be dcat:Dataset for each Dataset.

title.title: Title
title.description: Human-readable name of the asset. Should be in plain English and include sufficient detail to facilitate search and discovery.

identifier.title: Unique Identifier
identifier.description: A unique identifier for the dataset or API as maintained within an Agency catalog or database.

description.title: Description
description.description: Human-readable description (e.g., an abstract) with sufficient detail to enable a user to quickly understand whether the asset is of interest.

accessLevel.description: The degree to which this dataset could be made publicly-available, regardless of whether it has been made available. Choices: public (Data asset is or could be made publicly available to all without restrictions), restricted public (Data asset is available under certain use restrictions), or non-public (Data asset is not available to members of the public).
accessLevel.title: Public Access Level

accrualPeriodicity.title: Frequency
accrualPeriodicity.description: Frequency with which dataset is published.

describedBy.title: Data Dictionary
describedBy.description: URL to the data dictionary for the dataset or API. Note that documentation other than a data dictionary can be referenced using Related Documents as shown in the expanded fields.

describedByType.title: Data Dictionary Type
describedByType.description: The machine-readable file format (IANA Media Type or MIME Type) of the distributionâ€™s describedBy URL.

modified.title: Last Update
modified.description: Most recent date on which the dataset was changed, updated or modified.

license.title: License
license.description: The license dataset or API is published with. See Open Licenses for more information.

spatial.title: Spatial
spatial.description: The spatial coverage of the dataset. Could include a spatial region like a bounding box or a named place.

temporal.title: Temporal
temporal.description: The start and end dates for which the dataset is applicable, separated by a "/" (i.e., 2000-01-15T00:45:00Z/2010-01-15T00:06:00Z).

isPartOf.title: Collection
isPartOf.description: The collection of which the dataset is a subset.

@type.title: Metadata Context
@type.description: IRI for the JSON-LD data type. This should be org:Organization for each publisher

contactPoint.title: Project Open Data ContactPoint vCard
contactPoint.description: A Dataset ContactPoint as a vCard object.

@type.title: Metadata Context
@type.description: IRI for the JSON-LD data type. This should be vcard:Contact for contactPoint.

fn.title: Contact Name
fn.description: A full formatted name, e.g. Firstname Lastname.

hasEmail.title: Email
hasEmail.description: Email address for the contact name.

theme.title: Category
theme.description: Main thematic category of the dataset.

keyword.title: Tags
keyword.description: Tags (or keywords) help users discover your dataset; please include terms that would be used by technical and non-technical users.

distribution.title: Distribution
distribution.description: A distribution is a container for the data object. Each distribution should contain one accessURL or downloadURL. When providing a downloadURL, also include the format of the file.

@type.title: Metadata Context
@type.description: IRI for the JSON-LD data type. This should be dcat:Distribution for each Distribution.

format.title: Format
format.description: A human-readable description of the file format of a distribution (i.e. csv, pdf, kml, etc.).

mediaType.title: Media Type
mediaType.description: The machine-readable file format (IANA Media Type or MIME Type) of the distributionâ€™s downloadURL.

downloadURL.title: Download URL
downloadURL.description: URL providing direct access to a downloadable file of a dataset.

accessURL.title: Access URL
accessURL.description: URL providing indirect access to a dataset.

conformsTo.title: Data Standard
conformsTo.description: URL providing indirect access to a dataset.

describedBy.title: Data Dictionary
describedBy.description: URL to the data dictionary for the distribution found at the downloadURL.

describedByType.title: Data Dictionary Type
describedByType.description: The machine-readable file format (IANA Media Type or MIME Type) of the distributionâ€™s describedBy URL.

references.title: Related Documents
references.description: Related documents such as technical information about a dataset, developer documentation, etc.

bureauCode.title: Bureau Code
bureauCode.description: Federal agencies, combined agency and bureau code from OMB Circular A-11, Appendix C in the format of 015:010.

programCode.title: Program Code
programCode.description: Federal agencies, list the primary program related to this data asset, from the Federal Program Inventory. Use the format of 015:001

ui:options.description: This refers to how the data can be accessed.

ui:options.title: Relevant Location
ui:options.description: If your dataset has a spatial component, please provide location such as place name or latitude/longitude pairs.

enumNames: Open Data Commons Open Database License (ODbL)
Open Data Commons Public Domain Dedication and Licence (PDDL)

ui:options.extensions: csv html xls json xlsx doc docx rdf txt jpg png gif tiff pdf odf ods odt tsv tab geojson zip kml kmz shp

@type.title: Metadata Context
@type.description: IRI for the JSON-LD data type. This should be org:Organization for each publisher

distribution.title: Distribution
distribution.description: A container for the array of Distribution objects (data files).

@type.title: Metadata Context
@type.description: IRI for the JSON-LD data type. This should be dcat:Distribution for each Distribution.

format.title: Format
format.description: A human-readable description of the file format of a distribution (i.e. csv, pdf, xml, kml, etc.).

mediaType.title: Media Type
mediaType.description: The machine-readable file format (IANA Media Type or MIME Type) of the distributionâ€™s downloadURL.

downloadURL.title: Download URL
downloadURL.description: URL providing direct access to a downloadable file of a dataset.

accessURL.title: Access URL
accessURL.description: URL providing indirect access to a dataset.

conformsTo.title: Data Standard
conformsTo.description: URL providing indirect access to a dataset.

describedBy.title: Data Dictionary
describedBy.description: URL to the data dictionary for the distribution found at the downloadURL.

describedByType.title: Data Dictionary Type
describedByType.description: The machine-readable file format (IANA Media Type or MIME Type) of the distributionâ€™s describedBy URL.

theme.title: Category
theme.description: Main thematic category of the dataset.

data.title: Category
data.description: Main thematic category of the dataset.

keyword.title: Tags
keyword.description: Tags (or keywords) help users discover your dataset; please include terms that would be used by technical and non-technical users.

data.title: Tag
data.description: Tags (or keywords) help users discover your dataset; please include terms that would be used by technical and non-technical users.

data.title: Project Open Data Data-Dictionary
data.description: A data dictionary for this resource, compliant with the [Table Schema](https://specs.frictionlessdata.io/table-schema/) specification.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type keyword, which `MUST` be a value of `string`.

format.title: Format
format.description:
Supported formats depend on the specified field type:
* For `string` the supported formats are `default`, `email`, `uri`, `binary`, and `uuid`:
  - **default**: any valid string.
  - **email**: A valid email address.
  - **uri**: A valid URI.
  - **binary**: A base64 encoded string representing binary data.
  - **uuid**: A string that is a uuid.
* For `number` only `default` is allowed.
* For `integer` only `default` is allowed.
* For `date` the supported formats are `default`, `any`, and `{PATTERN}`:
  - **default**: An ISO8601 format string of YYYY-MM-DD.
  - **any**: Any parsable representation of a date. The implementing library can attempt to parse the datetime via a range of strategies.
  - **{PATTERN}**: The value can be parsed according to `{PATTERN}`, which `MUST` follow the date formatting syntax of C / Python [strftime](http://strftime.org/).
* For `time` the supported formats are `default`, `any`, and `{PATTERN}`:
  - **default**: An ISO8601 format string for time.
  - **any**: Any parsable representation of a date. The implementing library can attempt to parse the datetime via a range of strategies.
  - **{PATTERN}**: The value can be parsed according to `{PATTERN}`, which `MUST` follow the date formatting syntax of C / Python [strftime](http://strftime.org/).
* For `datetime` the supported formats are `default`, `any`, and `{PATTERN}`:
  - **default**: An ISO8601 format string for datetime.
  - **any**: Any parsable representation of a date. The implementing library can attempt to parse the datetime via a range of strategies.
  - **{PATTERN}**: The value can be parsed according to `{PATTERN}`, which `MUST` follow the date formatting syntax of C / Python [strftime](http://strftime.org/).
* For `year` only `default` is allowed.
* For `yearmonth` only `default` is allowed.
* For `boolean` only `default` is allowed.
* For `object` only `default` is allowed.
* For `geopoint` the supported formats are `default`, `array`, and `object`:
  - **default**: A string of the pattern 'lon, lat', where `lon` is the longitude and `lat` is the latitude.
  - **array**: An array of exactly two items, where each item is either a number, or a string parsable as a number, and the first item is `lon` and the second item is `lat`.
  - **object**: A JSON object with exactly two keys, `lat` and `lon`
* For `geojson` the supported formats are `default` and `topojson`:
  - **default**: A geojson object as per the [GeoJSON spec](http://geojson.org/).
  - **topojson**: A topojson object as per the [TopoJSON spec](https://github.com/topojson/topojson-specification/blob/master/README.md).
* For `array` only `default` is allowed.
* For `duration` only `default` is allowed.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: One or more fields included in index. Must be keys from the fields object.

description.title: Description
description.description: Description of index purpose or functionality.
